content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code snippet in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col) 
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```

In this function, `lowercase(strip(col))` converts the column name to lower case and removes any leading or trailing white spaces. The `replace()` function replaces all space characters and hyphens with underscores. This is achieved by using a regular expression (`r"[\s-]"`) that matches either a whitespace character or a hyphen, and `"_"` which is the replacement string for these matched characters.
